title: South Korea plane crash live: Jeju Air CEO apologises; 179 passengers and crew feared killed - Hindustan Times
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash: Jeju Air CEO Apologises; 179 Passengers and Crew Feared Killed

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic plane crash involving a Jeju Air flight has left 179 passengers and crew feared dead, with only two survivors confirmed so far. The accident occurred during landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The Jeju Air flight from Bangkok had a total of 181 people onboard.
  • Initial reports suggest a bird strike combined with adverse weather likely caused the crash.
  • Authorities have already recovered 120 bodies and continue searching for more victims.
  • The crash is being called one of the deadliest in South Korean aviation history.
  • Condolences have poured in from international leaders, expressing sorrow for the victims.
“I feel profound responsibility for this incident.” - Kim E-bae, CEO of Jeju Air.

This devastating incident has shocked the nation, prompting immediate emergency response and investigations into the causes of the crash.
newTitle: South Korea Plane Crash: Jeju Air CEO Issues Apology as 179 Feared Dead

title: Year Ender 2024: Big ticket investments boosts Tamil Nadu's USD 1 trillion dream - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

Publication Date: 2024

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Tamil Nadu made significant strides in 2024 to achieve its ambitious goal of a USD 1 trillion economy by 2030, driven by major investments and strategic policies initiated by the DMK government.

  • The state hosted its first Global Investors Meet (GIM) in January 2024, securing ₹6.64 lakh crore in investment commitments that could create 26 lakh jobs.
  • Significant investments include ₹16,000 crore from VinFast for a manufacturing facility, generating 20,000 jobs, and ₹9,000 crore from Tata Motors for electric vehicle production.
  • Chief Minister MK Stalin engaged with international investors, signing multiple MoUs in the US and Spain totaling ₹7,618 crore in commitments, leading to the creation of 12,000 jobs.
  • The government focused on boosting the electric vehicle sector by exploring charging infrastructure along major roads.
  • Mini-TIDEL Parks will be established to extend IT sector benefits to smaller towns, each accommodating around 500 IT professionals.
  • Political analyst Sumanth Raman highlighted the need for greater transparency regarding investment commitments with a public dashboard.
“It is the easiest thing to do (to set up a dashboard). But the government has not done it.” - Sumanth Raman

2024 was a key year for Tamil Nadu as it positioned itself for future economic growth amid ongoing efforts to strengthen investor relations and local job creation.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

title: Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Bowler In The World To... - News18
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Creates History as First Bowler to Achieve 200 Wickets with Average Below 20

Last Updated: December 29, 2024, 14:30 IST, Source: News18

‘National asset’ Jasprit Bumrah has made history by becoming the first bowler in Test cricket to take over 200 wickets with an average below 20. As of now, he has 202 wickets at an average of 19.38.

  • Bumrah completed his 200th wicket by dismissing Travis Head.
  • He surpassed Kapil Dev's record for the fastest Indian pacer to 200 wickets.
  • Bumrah leads the 2023-25 World Test Championship with 74 wickets in just 14 matches.
“Bumrah has achieved this feat in only 44 matches, compared to Kapil Dev's 50 matches.”

This milestone solidifies Bumrah's standing as a premier fast bowler in cricket history, highlighting his incredible talent and skill.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Creates History as First Bowler to Achieve 200 Wickets with Average Below 20

title: South Korea plane crash LIVE: 85 killed as Jeju aircraft landing gear malfunctioned; flights cancelled at Muan airport - The Hindu
summary:
South Korea plane crash LIVE: 85 killed as Jeju aircraft landing gear malfunctioned; two rescued

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A tragic aviation disaster occurred in South Korea when a passenger plane caught fire after skidding off the runway due to a landing gear malfunction, resulting in at least 85 fatalities.

  • The Jeju Air passenger plane was carrying 181 people and was landing at Muan International Airport.
  • The incident happened around 9:03 AM local time.
  • Emergency workers rescued two individuals, one passenger and one crew member.
  • Flights at Muan airport have been canceled following the accident.
  • This incident is noted as one of South Korea's worst aviation disasters, recalling a similar tragedy from 1997.
“It’s one of the deadliest disasters in South Korea’s aviation history.”

The incident raises urgent questions about aviation safety standards and equipment reliability.
newTitle: Tragic Plane Crash in South Korea Claims 85 Lives

title: 4 from Gujarat held in Bengaluru for siphoning off Rs 12.5 cr from fintech firm CRED - Deccan Herald
summary:
Four Arrested in Bengaluru for Rs 12.5 Crore Fraud Linked to Fintech Firm CRED

Published: 29 December 2024, Source: DH

Bengaluru police have arrested four individuals from Gujarat, including an Axis Bank employee, for allegedly siphoning off Rs 12.5 crore from CRED by stealing data and forging banking documents.

  • The mastermind, Vaibhav Pitadiya, exploited loopholes in CRED's corporate account.
  • Rs 1.83 crore has been recovered so far.
  • Fraudulent transactions were discovered during a reconciliation exercise.
  • Pitadiya and associates forged documents to open mule accounts and initiate unauthorized transactions.
“Neha submitted a fake CIB form along with forged documents to Axis Bank in Ankleshwar, requesting for adding another user with a new email and phone number.”

The police investigation revealed operations spanned from October 29 to November 11, during which multiple fraudulent transactions occurred.
newTitle: Four Arrested in Bengaluru for Rs 12.5 Crore Fraud Linked to Fintech Firm CRED

title: FIDE World Rapid Championships 2024: Koneru Humpy wins second title; Arjun Erigaisi finishes 5th - ESPN India
summary:
Koneru Humpy Claims Second Title at FIDE World Rapid Championships 2024

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: ESPN

Koneru Humpy capped an impressive year for Indian chess by winning her second FIDE World Rapid Championship title in 2024, finishing with a score of 8.5/11 in New York.

Key Points:

  • Humpy defeated Indonesia's Irene Sukandar in the final round to secure the championship.
  • This marks Humpy's second world rapid title, with her first win in 2019.
  • Arjun Erigaisi finished 5th in the open section, narrowly missing out on a Candidates tournament spot.
  • 18-year-old Volodar Murzin won the open section, making history as the second youngest winner.

Notable Quotes:

“Congratulations to Humpy Koneru, the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Champion!” - International Chess Federation (@FIDE_chess)

“The final round endgame was such a class” - Harikrishna (@HariChess)

Conclusion:

The Championships highlighted the excellence of Indian players in chess, with Humpy's victory further solidifying her legacy in the sport.
newTitle: Koneru Humpy Claims Second Title at FIDE World Rapid Championships 2024
